events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle late last night on a busy intersection and filed an initial claim for damage assessment.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a car collision and physical damages noted.
An agent specializing in vehicle accident claims was assigned to manage the case and contact the claimant for further details.
The insurer acknowledged receipt of all initial documents and assured the claimant that the process is underway promptly.
Additional documents including photographs of the vehicle damage and police report from the accident were requested for investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos and police accident report, to support the claim evaluation.
The claim investigation officially started, focusing on verifying the collision circumstances and assessing vehicle damage accurately.
Investigation was completed with all facts verified, including third-party statements and damage appraisal from certified mechanics.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the estimated repair costs and policy coverage limits outlined in the claimant’s contract.
The customer expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, requesting a reevaluation or alternative solutions.
Due to the feedback, the claim was escalated to a senior claims adjuster for further review and possible adjustment of settlement terms.
The senior adjuster approved the claim with an increased settlement amount after reassessing the vehicle damage and policy conditions.
Payment was successfully issued to the claimant’s bank account covering the approved amount needed for vehicle repairs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and repair work commencement was acknowledged by the customer.
All files and records related to the claim were archived in the system for future reference and compliance purposes.
